verses.verse: "But now those who are younger <WH6810> than I have me in derision, <WH7832> whose fathers <WH1> I would have disdained <WH3988> to put <WH7896> with my sheep <WH6629> dogs. <WH3611>
Of what use <WH4100> is the strength <WH3581> of their hands <WH3027> to me, <WH3624> men in whom ripe age has perished? <WH6>
They are gaunt <WH1565> from lack <WH2639> and famine. <WH3720> They gnaw <WH6207> the dry ground, <WH6723> in the gloom <WH570> of waste <WH4875> and desolation. <WH7722>
They pluck <WH6998> salt herbs <WH4408> by the bushes. <WH7880> The roots <WH8328> of the broom <WH7574> are their food. <WH3899>
They are driven out <WH1644> from the midst <WH1460> of men. <WH7321> They cry after them as after a thief; <WH1590>
So that they dwell <WH7931> in frightful <WH6178> valleys, <WH5158> and in holes <WH2356> of the earth <WH6083> and of the rocks. <WH3710>
Among the bushes <WH7880> they bray; <WH5101> and under the nettles <WH2738> they are gathered together. <WH5596>
They are children <WH1121> of fools, <WH5036> yes, <WH1121> children of base men. <WH8034> They were flogged <WH5217> out of the land. <WH776>
"Now I have become their song. <WH5058> Yes, <WH4405> I am a byword to them.
They abhor <WH8581> me, <WH7368> they stand aloof from me, <WH2820> and don't hesitate to spit <WH7536> in my face. <WH6440>
For he has untied <WH6605> his cord, <WH3499> and afflicted <WH6031> me; <WH7971> and they have thrown off restraint <WH7448> before me. <WH6440>
On my right <WH3225> hand rise <WH6965> the rabble. <WH6526> They thrust aside <WH7971> my feet, <WH7272> They cast up <WH5549> against me their ways <WH734> of destruction. <WH343>
They mar <WH5420> my path, <WH5410> They set forward <WH3276> my calamity, <WH1942> without anyone <WH5826>'s help.
As through a wide <WH7342> breach <WH6556> they come, <WH857> in the midst <WH8478> of the ruin <WH7722> they roll themselves in. <WH1556>
Terrors <WH1091> have turned <WH2015> on me. <WH7291> They chase my honor <WH5082> as the wind. <WH7307> My welfare <WH3444> has passed away <WH5674> as a cloud. <WH5645>
"Now my soul <WH5315> is poured out <WH8210> within me. <WH3117> Days of affliction <WH6040> have taken hold on me. <WH270>
In the night season <WH3915> my bones <WH6106> are pierced <WH5365> in me, <WH6207> and the pains that gnaw me take no rest. <WH7901>
By great <WH7230> force <WH3581> is my garment <WH3830> disfigured. <WH2664> It binds me about <WH247> as the collar <WH6310> of my coat. <WH3801>
He has cast <WH3384> me into the mire. <WH2563> I have become like <WH4911> dust <WH6083> and ashes. <WH665>
I cry <WH7768> to you, <WH6030> and you do not answer me. <WH5975> I stand up, and you gaze at me. <WH995>
You have turned <WH2015> to be cruel <WH393> to me. <WH6108> With the might of your hand <WH3027> you persecute me. <WH7852>
You lift me up <WH5375> to the wind, <WH7307> and drive <WH7392> me with it. <WH4127> You dissolve me in the storm. <WH8454>
For I know <WH3045> that you will bring <WH7725> me to death, <WH4194> To the house <WH1004> appointed <WH4150> for all living. <WH2416>
"However doesn't <WH7971> one stretch out a hand <WH3027> in his fall? <WH1164> Or in his calamity <WH6365> therefore cry for help? <WH7769>
Didn't <WH1058> I weep for him who was in trouble? <WH7186> Wasn't <WH5315> my soul grieved <WH5701> for the needy? <WH34>
When I looked <WH6960> for good, <WH2896> then evil <WH7451> came; <WH935> When I waited <WH3176> for light, <WH216> there came <WH935> darkness. <WH652>
My heart <WH4578> is troubled, <WH7570> and doesn't <WH1826> rest. Days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> have come on me. <WH6923>
I go <WH1980> mourning <WH6937> without the sun. <WH2535> I stand up <WH6965> in the assembly, <WH6951> and cry for help. <WH7768>
I am a brother <WH251> to jackals, <WH8577> and a companion <WH7453> to ostriches. <WH1323>
My skin <WH5785> grows black <WH7835> and peels from me. <WH6106> My bones are burned <WH2787> with heat. <WH2721>
Therefore my harp <WH3658> has turned to mourning, <WH60> and my pipe <WH5748> into the voice <WH6963> of those who weep. <WH1058>
